key_points: Sacha Baron Cohen called for YouTube to ban Donald Trump's account, following the actions of other social platforms.
Cohen's request comes in an effort to prevent the spread of election misinformation and to 'save democracy'.
He specifically called out YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki and Google CEO Sundar Pichai in a tweet.
As of the article's publication, Trump's YouTube channel had approximately 2.74 million subscribers.
Cohen also celebrated the ban of Trump from Twitter and Facebook, showing his consistent stance against Trump's presence on social media platforms.
Twitter announced Trump's permanent suspension, citing the risk of further incitement of violence.
Instagram and Reddit have also removed Trump from their platforms.
Sacha Baron Cohen has been vocal about his criticisms of Donald Trump, especially related to the events at Capitol Hill.
The request for comment from Google, YouTube's parent company, was not immediately answered.
Sacha Baron Cohen uses the hashtag '#BanTrumpSaveDemocracy' to rally support for his cause.
